logic.token

Class Domino

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.token.Domino
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Domino
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    A Domino has a tile, a rotation and a position. Rotation 0 shows a horizontal orientated domino with the first value on the left and the second on the right.

    Rotation: the first value of the domino is the one under the cursor. rotation 0 - horizontally - not rotated - snd is right of fst 1 - vertically - rotated 90 degrees - snd is bottom of fst 2 - horizontally - rotated 180 degrees - snd is left of fst 3 - vertically - rotated 270 degrees - snd is top of fst

      • fill

        public static java.util.List<Domino> fill(java.util.List<Domino> list)
        gets all values of Tiles in a list. All existing dominos in list have to be removed so each domino is single in list.
        Parameters:
        list - list to be cleared and added to
        Returns:
        same list with all dominos once each

      • getStrAllignment

        public java.lang.String getStrAllignment()
        Generates a String representing the rotation of a domino
        Returns:
        STR_HORI when domino is not rotated or is rotated twice, STR_VERTI if the domino is rotated once or three times.

      • incRot

        public Domino incRot()

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        dominos are equal if the have the same tile (rotation may differ), exact reference as well as the token value does not matter.

        Meaning: - domino a with the reference -> #123; value -> HOHO_VAL13; rotation -> 1 - domino a with the reference -> #124; value -> HOHO_VAL14; rotation -> 0 Both dominoes are equal

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - object to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the given arg is a domino with the same tile comibination (rotation may differ)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toFile

        public java.lang.String toFile()
        String representation used in the fileIO. Depending on the rotation the upper / left tile will be displayed as the first singletile before the separator, and the right / lower tile as the second.
        Returns:
        String representation of the domino used in the fileIO

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(int rotation)
        Setter for the rotation
        Parameters:
        rotation - rotation to be set for the current domino
